intro: Romanschulzia resediflora var. lasiocarpa, commonly known as the silky-hair lily, is a rare and striking plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, showy flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features a bulbous stem and produces clusters of pale pink to lilac flowers with long, silky hairs on the petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
